title: Business & Finance
text:
VW is close to selling a minority stake in its U.S. electric vehicle recharging business to an arm of Siemens in a deal that would value the network at over $2 billion.

---

JetBlue isn't backing down in its fight to buy Spirit Airlines, raising its offer yet again in an effort to outmaneuver rival Frontier.

---

Toshiba shareholders approved the industrial conglomerate's proposal to invite representatives from two foreign activist funds onto its board.

---

General Electric said CEO Culp is immediately taking over the reins of the company's jet-engine business.

---

U.S. stocks lost ground, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow falling 0.3%, 0.7% and 0.2%, respectively.

---

Tencent's largest shareholder scrapped a promise not to sell more stock in the company until 2024, saying it would pare its stake to fund a share-buyback program.

---

Digital World, the SPAC that plans to merge with Trump's social-media company, said a federal grand jury issued subpoenas to all its board members.

---

Nike's quarterly sales were roughly flat and its inventory surged, signs the sneaker giant is still trying to balance consumer demand with supply-chain snarls.
